Articles.Content: Does anyone have suggestions for apps they find useful? Any games that are actually games rather than microtransaction-based skinner boxes? It's a 2013 Nexus 7, so there shouldn't be any compatibility issues.
I enjoy the game The Infinite Black.
I like this game called Clash of Clans. Also, if you like "hack-ish" games, try Hack RUN.

There are the basic games like Solitaire and Chess, but I'm sure you've thought and sought along these lines. Galaxy on Fire 2 is pretty decent. Space Agency has inaccurate orbital physics but is entertaining nonetheless. Terraria recently made an appearance, too, and that is an addictive game (better on PC, but still worth a look).

Also, if you like astronomy, then get Stellarium. It shows where everything will be in the night sky; very useful.

i have an old android tablet that my sister was getting rid of. ive yet to find one game or app with any level of quality or usability.

apps are just half-assed applications.
SimpleRockets is a decent substitute for KSP when you're on the go.

There's a very good x com clone, I can't think of the name of it off the top of my head and my Nexus is in the car. Try searching the Marketplace for X-com. I can't remember if it was free or not, but there are no microtransactions.

Big download, be warned. Gameplay is pretty good, not perfect but that's because of the touch screen. Graphics are above average.

There's also a turn based tactical shooter, anti terrorism operational type game that is very nice. You can pick a Seal, Delta, SaS, or Ranger team and go through various maps. You select your teammates and level them up. For a tablet game, it's outstanding. I had to replace my tablet so I don't have it installed and I can't remember the name of it either. It's not free, but the content with the paid game is good. There are two DLC packs consisting of new missions with new maps. It can be very difficult to score well because you have to clear maps, clear objectives, and do so with time considerations. Excellent graphics, very good controls. RPG style leveling, weapon and armor variety is very good, also weapon customization including attachments. Think Jagged Alliance 2 in a Rainbow Six setting. EDIT: Breach and Clear is the name.

Plague Inc

Dwarves vs Orcs is surprisingly good, but there are issues with translation.

I also recommend these tower defense games:

Both of the Kingdom Rush games

Both of the Myth Defense games

Tentacle Wars is a very good puzzle game.

Talisman Prologue, based on the original board game.

Sword and Glory is a good one, very difficult. Rogue type hack and slash RPG.

Carmageddon (yes, the original PC game)

Star Traders RPG

Steambirds

Kindle

Swiss Army Knife

Slidenotes

OnStar if you have an OnStar vehicle

Here's some of the, IMHO, better applications I've installed:

Augment (useful for larger screens)

Flightradar24 (very cool)

Freeballs (interesting particle simulator)

FrequenSee (shows a logarithmic graph of the sounds the device listens to)

Gravity (great game based on the movie, it has multiplayer, too)

ISS Detector (the name explains it all)

KSP Orbicalc and KSPCalculator

Liquid Fun (again, particles, goofy and fun entertainment)

Metal Detector (somewhat useful and fun)

Physics Toolbox series (accelerometer and magnetometer apps, cool real time graphs)

Star Chart (highly useful, real time sky tracking)

Weather, by Yahoo (sleek, beautiful, nonintrusive and exhaustive weather report and prognosis)

Principia. The only 'must have' game in my opinion. Its mega hard, but you can build just about anything if you set your mind to it. In sandbox mode, you can build something as simple as a car, or build something that will fry your brain just trying to figure out the wiring. I very rarely get into stuff so heavily, but this and KSP are my 2 that I always come back to.
